docs.lead_paragraph: Evidence is building for the theory that Zika can cause newborn brain defects and the World Health Organization is promising more answers in weeks, but nailing a definitive link will be neither simple nor swift.

headline.main: Insight: Proving Zika Guilty-A Long and Painstaking Task
headline.print_headline: Insight: Proving Zika Guilty-A Long and Painstaking Task

docs.snippet: Evidence is building for the theory that Zika can cause newborn brain defects and the World Health Organization is promising more answers in weeks, but nailing a definitive link will be neither simple nor swift.

docs.lead_paragraph: Teams of U.S. and Brazilian health workers ventured into dicey slums, fought through snarled traffic and braved torrential downpours on the first day of their effort to determine if the Zika virus is causing babies to be born with a birth defect affecting the brain.

headline.main: US, Brazilian Health Teams Go Into Slums to Start Zika Study
headline.print_headline: US, Brazilian Health Teams Go Into Slums to Start Zika Study

docs.snippet: Teams of U.S. and Brazilian health workers ventured into dicey slums, fought through snarled traffic and braved torrential downpours on the first day of their effort to determine if the Zika virus is causing babies to be born with a birth defect...

docs.lead_paragraph: Ideas drawn from psychology are helping Americans make better economic choices, but they fail to address problems in areas like retirement savings.

headline.main: Nudges Aren’t Enough for Problems Like Retirement Savings
headline.print_headline: Nudges Aren’t Enough to Solve Society’s Problems

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column contends behavorial economics-based nudges like automatically signing up employees for 401(k) plans are not enough to solve retirement savings dearth, let alone cure poverty and other societal problems.
docs.snippet: Ideas drawn from psychology are helping Americans make better economic choices, but they fail to address problems in areas like retirement savings.

keywords.value: Nudge: Improving Decisions About Health, Wealth, and Happiness (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

docs.lead_paragraph: The agency said it was investigating new cases of transmission from male travelers to female partners and had confirmed two of them.

headline.main: C.D.C. Investigating 14 New Reports of Zika Transmission Through Sex
headline.print_headline: 14 New Reports of Sexual Transmission of Zika in U.S.

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is investigating 14 reports of sexual transmission of Zika virus, including to pregnant women; cases, if confirmed, would have major implications for controlling virus thought to be mainly spread by mosquito bites.
docs.snippet: The agency said it was investigating new cases of transmission from male travelers to female partners and had confirmed two of them.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Missouri voters, who were among the first nationally to adopt a constitutional ban on gay marriage, could get a say later this year on whether to grant greater religious protections to some business owners and individuals who object to same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Missouri Measure Seeks Religious Exemptions on Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Missouri Measure Seeks Religious Exemptions on Gay Marriage

headline.main: CDC: 14 More US Reports of Possible Zika Spread Through Sex

docs.lead_paragraph: A Colorado jury on Tuesday convicted a woman of attempted murder and assault for stabbing a pregnant stranger and cutting her fetus from her womb, after luring the victim to her home with an online advertisement for free maternity clothes.

headline.main: Colorado Woman Convicted of Cutting Fetus From Stranger's Womb
headline.print_headline: Colorado Woman Convicted of Cutting Fetus From Stranger's Womb

docs.snippet: A Colorado jury on Tuesday convicted a woman of attempted murder and assault for stabbing a pregnant stranger and cutting her fetus from her womb, after luring the victim to her home with an online advertisement for free maternity clothes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Colorado woman who prosecutors said was obsessed with having a baby and concocted elaborate lies to convince those close to her that she was pregnant was convicted Tuesday of cutting a nearly 8-month-old fetus from a stranger's womb.

headline.main: Colorado Woman Guilty of Cutting Baby From Stranger's Womb
headline.print_headline: Colorado Woman Guilty of Cutting Baby From Stranger's Womb

docs.snippet: A Colorado woman who prosecutors said was obsessed with having a baby and concocted elaborate lies to convince those close to her that she was pregnant was convicted Tuesday of cutting a nearly 8-month-old fetus from a stranger's womb.
